Responses to open text questions


Web Site: University of Essex
Date of Analysis: August 08, 2020
Number of Responses Analysed: 17

Return to Summary Page



Is there anything you think is missing from this web site?
Respondent ID Comment
1 N/A
2 felt like i was not visiting an academic website...
3 the homepage has too large a spread, and not enough links to where you want to go. Small icon for menu
4 The overall website is well-designed. Sometimes I feel too much content on the same page due to the large font.
5 A lot of thing is missing and need to be well structured.
6 No.
7 the professors were very difficult to find, they could only be found under "supervisors" then it linked to some research groups, while usually university websites have all faculty members profiles easily available under each department.
8 Everything this was great.
9 it seems a bit crowded, maybe more space.
10 It is kinda weird that list bar is on the right top instead of left top (usually they put it on the left top). When I clicked it, I found hard to notice parts in the middle right of the page (such as STUDY, LIFE, NEW STUDENT parts). I think the size front is so large that it might be considererd as a slogan.
11 Not missing per se... but those huge thumbnails are annoying.
12
13 Fonts are extremly big and its super annoying to use the website
14 A-z sections and departments links on the top
15 Search Option need to make workable
16 colors are bad and organization
17 Not sure

How to read the table

The table on this page displays actual unedited comments each respondent made to the open question. If blank, no comment was made. The best way of looking at them is to read the comments and notice themes which occur regularly.


Content Analysis service at WAMMI.COM

WAMMI provides a popular additional service where respondents comments are sorted into a mangeable number of categories and presented according to percentage distribution and global usability scores. Examples of comments for each category are given in a written report. Please contact us for information about our Content Analysis Service.
